messages.subject: Re: mon question
messages.msgSnippet: ... This mon is called Maru ni Tsuru-Kashiwa (Circle and Japanese ivy oak) I do not know which daimyo used this mon. This mon was mainly used by shrines.
messages.messageBody:
>
> can anyone help me identify this mon ?
> thanks...........
>

This mon is called "Maru ni Tsuru-Kashiwa"(Circle and Japanese ivy oak)

I do not know which daimyo used this mon.

This mon was mainly used by shrines.

yanofuji28

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Re: mon question
messages.msgSnippet: Thank you very much. I did not know the Matsudaira - Tokugawa relationship. The wakizashi koshirae this tsuba is on has extremely nice Tokugawa mon menuki.
messages.messageBody:

messages.subject: Re: mon question
messages.msgSnippet: ... This is the mon of Matsudaira (Ogyu) family of Bungo funai (Now Oita prefecture). This mon is called Maru ni Kuginuki (Circle and nail puller ) By the
messages.messageBody:
> Following the URL,
> Can anyone tell me what is the mon 4th from the bottom
> on the left hand side (a circle with a square inside)?

This is the mon of Matsudaira (Ogyu) family of Bungo funai (Now Oita
prefecture).

This mon is called "Maru ni Kuginuki"(Circle and nail puller")

By the way, 5 th from the bottom on the left is also a mon of
Matsudaira (Ogyu), but of Mikawa (Now Aichi prefecture).

As you may know, Matsudairas are relatives of Tokugawas.

yanofuji28

messages.messageBody:
Following the URL,
Can anyone tell me what is the mon 4th from the bottom
on the left hand side (a circle with a square inside)?

A small tsuba I own has this mon, but I've never
bothered looking it up.

Curran
